reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

description.narrative: 1. Project: 11898 Youth Peace Initiative Project#2. Project area and Country: Kayin State, Myanmar#3. Project justification: #In Myanmar, 55% of the population is under the age of thirty, with those aged 15-29 accounting for one quarter of the total popula tion. Yet, youth involvement in governance is very limited and the youth are not invited to take part in decision-making or peace processes. While there is great potential for young leaders and their role as agents of change to promote social cohesion is e ssential, many do not acknowledge the importance of youth participation. Few opportunities and channels exit for the youth to engage in and exercise their leadership at community and regional levels. The youth and the local communities also find it difficu lt to engage in official processes due to lack of information and language barriers. Currently there are few capacity building initiatives aiming at addressing the various barriers to youths effective participation. #4. The main objective and expected resu lts: #The projects main objective is to promote the targeted youths effective participation in peace building and to equip them with the skills and capacities to engage in vertical and horizontal peace dialogue processes. The project also aims at empowerin g the youth to lead and contribute to advocacy efforts promoting community development and peace building. The youth will be equipped with the necessary skills to effectively participate in the peace processes and decision-making on community and national levels. The youths understanding and knowledge of peace related issues will increase, while the project will also establish spaces for dialogue between the youth and various key stakeholders. The project will support the organisation of the youth networks activities and the networks collaboration with other youth networks on regional and national levels. Various workshops will promote dialogue and allow the sharing of experiences and lessons learnt between the youth networks, government representatives, pol itical party representatives and other key stakeholders. #5. Right-holders/ beneficiaries: Youth (16 to 35 years) in Kayin State (individual, youth groups, youth from EAOs, youth from political parties, youth from literature and culture committee and yout h from CSOs)#Duty bearers: Government of Myanmar, Union, State, Township, Ethnic Armed Groups, INGOs/NGOs and CSOs#6. Implementing partner: Swe Tha Har Organization

1. Project: 11898 Youth Peace Initiative Project#2. Project area and Country: Kayin State, Myanmar#3. While there is great potential for young leaders and their role as agents of change to promote social cohesion is e ssential, many do not acknowledge the importance of youth participation. Few opportunities and channels exit for the youth to engage in and exercise their leadership at community and regional levels. The youth and the local communities also find it difficu lt to engage in official processes due to lack of information and language barriers. Currently there are few capacity building initiatives aiming at addressing the various barriers to youths effective participation. #4. The main objective and expected resu lts: #The projects main objective is to promote the targeted youths effective participation in peace building and to equip them with the skills and capacities to engage in vertical and horizontal peace dialogue processes. Right-holders/ beneficiaries: Youth (16 to 35 years) in Kayin State (individual, youth groups, youth from EAOs, youth from political parties, youth from literature and culture committee and yout h from CSOs)#Duty bearers: Government of Myanmar, Union, State, Township, Ethnic Armed Groups, INGOs/NGOs and CSOs#6.
